intro: Bactris faucium, commonly known as the red raphia, is a member of the Arecaceae family, native to the Amazon Basin. It is a tall, slender palm that can grow up to 15 meters in height, characterized by its elongated, pinnate leaves. The plant produces large, yellowish-orange inflorescences that bear both male and female flowers, typical of many palm species. Its fruit is a fibrous, three-lobed structure that contains a single seed, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Bactris faucium plays a role in local ecosystems and has been used by indigenous communities for various purposes.
